The defendant, Andrew Collier, has filed a motion to have all claims against him dismissed. (beat) He argues that since his jewelry business was a corporation, the plaintiffs should not be allowed to go after his persona. assets. Nick smiles at Liz. Exactly. JUDGE PURVIEW (CONT’ D) When, however, a corporation is underfunded, it constitutes little more than a fraud. He got rich, the corporation stayed poor, and his victims are left with nothing. That is not what the law intends. Liz What?
